intro: Marsea capillipes, commonly known as the slender seagrass, is a marine plant belonging to the family Zosteraceae. It is characterized by its long, flexible leaves that are typically less than 1 meter in length. This species thrives in shallow, coastal waters and is often found in sandy or muddy substrates. Its root system forms dense mats that stabilize sediments and provide habitat for various marine organisms. Marsea capillipes plays an important role in coastal ecosystems by contributing to water filtration and supporting biodiversity.
